intro: Cacalia rupestris, commonly known as the rock cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Cacalia rupestris is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
